intro: Aeollanthus crenatus, commonly known as the serrated aeollanthus, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible parts. The plant features lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges, giving it its common name. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish or reddish in color. Aeollanthus crenatus is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
